revised_title: Description of a Large Calculus from the Human Bladder
tldr: This article describes the removal of a large calculus from the human bladder of Sir James Ogilvie. The calculus weighed 44 ounces and was considered the largest on record. It was removed after a fruitless attempt to remove it through lithotomy. The stone's texture was less compact than usual and contained ammoniacal phosphate of magnesia and phosphate of lime.
